text:
PAUL BEGALY: He lost to Hillary
Clinton in the popular vote

by 2.8 million.
He's haunted by that.
That's what he needs.
He's a needy little baby.

What he needs as a
president, though,
is to unify the country.

He needs, as a politician,
just to expand his base.
OK?

If you want to be small
minded, he needs to expand
his base as a politician.

But as a president,
he needs to expand.

We're going to wait 1,361
days, and he's still

going to be the moral midget
that you saw on that stand
in Harrisburg tonight.

PARIS DENNARD: We have to
put some things in context.

When you look at
President Trump,

and the way pundits, and
the people in the media

talk about him
and his candidacy,

the people around him in
the West Wing, his family,
it's deplorable.

And when you have that
type of rhetoric and tone

constantly beating at the
drum every single day, 24/7,
that is not helping America.

And Paul, when you-- listen,
I did not like probably

98% to 99% of the things
that President Obama did,

but I would never
call him Obama,

and I would never call
him a moral midget,

or a needy little baby,
even if I thought the two
things were true about him.

So as you sit here
with your platform

and attack the president
with these horrible sayings

about him personally,
and then say, well,

Mr. President, or Trump, you
are doing the same thing,

you have to have some
type of honesty about

how you're talking
about the president,

and how you are talking--
PAUL BEGALY: You are wrong.

No.
You are wrong, my friend.

PARIS DENNARD: And how you want
him to talk about other people.

We owe this president a little
bit more respect in how we talk

about him, because
there's a lot of Americans

out there who are suffering,
and who want to believe in him,

and when we belittle him, and
belittle everything about him,
and his family, his children--

PAUL BEGALY: I never
mentioned his family.

PARIS DENNARD: I'm
not talking about you,

but it's the tone that you
set, and other people that come
on this network and do this.

That's the problem, and that's
why he attacked the media.

PAUL BEGALY: You respect
the office, not the man.
I respect the office.
If he enters a room, I stand.
If he signs a law, I obey.
He is my president.

But he is letting me down, and
the vast majority of Americans
down.
